result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake S. Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake S. Gardner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Blake S. Gardner was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for alcohol and controlled substance upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee.  
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling ,and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blake S. Gardner in court, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Blake S. Gardner.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 2. State will move to dismiss Ct 1. State will recommend 1 year jail plus court cost. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Ct 2 dismiss per agreement. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation consecutive to current sentence with the following conditions: not to possess or consume any controlled substance unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, not to possess or consume in alcohol, to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to submit to random observed testing of alcohol and controlled substances upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee, to pay court costs, and to submit a DNA sample.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Blake S. Gardner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Blake S. Gardner. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Blake S. Gardner appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $5000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
